resources.string: The number must be between 1 and 8

If this setting is enabled, every time the accessibility service is started (a situation that also occurs when the device is rebooted), the number of notes to be played will be set to the value in the box below; ALSO DEVICE WILL BE LOCKED AUTOMATICALLY.\n\nIf this setting is disabled, every time the accessibility service is started, it will only start the main service used for lockscreen.

If this setting is enabled, if the main service used for lockscreen is active and device is locked, it will be settled the optimal value to be assigned to the multimedia volume based on perceived noise from the microphone.

It increases battery consumption.

In no case your personal data will be collected.

If enabled, the main service used for lockscreen undertakes, after device wakes up (e.g after the keyguard is gone), to start the lockscreen offered by LockScreen.

IF DURING THIS ACTIVITY ANY ACTION IS TAKEN TO BYPASS IT, DEVICE WILL BE LOCKED AGAIN.

This service can also be managed via quick setting.

Please do not start it if you do not have perfect pitch, you may not be able to unlock your device in emergency situations!

The following accessibility service undertakes only to LOCK THE DEVICE when:
1) any action is taken to bypass the lockscreen, if active, offered by LockScreen;
2) this service gets started (a situation that also occurs when the device is booted), if explicitly requested via settings.

In no case your personal data will be collected.
On Restart switch number of notes to play
On Restart list number of notes to play
